passages.text: China (PRC) I Metals & Mining
Satisfactory 2Q Despite Higher Cost in Gold,Mgmt See a Sequential Decline

Zijin reported a solid 2Q25 with NPAT of RMB13.1bn,+29% QoQ/+49%YoY. Mined gold unit COGS +8.2% QoQ/+17.8% YoY, and mgmt expect a sequential drop in 2H25 as cost reduction measures materialize. Mgmt acknowledges the complexities in Kamoa full recovery, but we believe the impact to Zijin will not be that significant. 25% interim payout is better than expected. Buy.

**Solid 2Q despite temporary spike in gold production cost.** Zijin reported RMB13.1bn NPAT in 2Q25,+29% QoQ/+49% YoY and better than expected; recurring NPAT was RMB11.7bn,+19% QoQ/+28% YoY and largely in line. 2Q saw c.RMB1.2bn higher FV and investment gain vs 1Q,which consists of ~RMB500mn disposal gain,~RMB300mn from hedging, and ~RMB400mn from stock holding. 2Q gold production was 22t vs 19t in 1Q25,+16% QoQ/+19% YoY, incl 1.2t from Akyem which was consolidated since mid-Apr; 2Q copper production was 279kt,-3% QoQ/+9% YoY, incl Kamoa contribution of 50kt,-16% QoQ/+11% YoY as it was affected by the seismic issue. Unit COGS for mined copper (weighted by products) was RMB24.4k/t in 2Q,+1.2% QoQ/+8.8% YoY (+6.6% vs 2024 whole year). Earlier this year, mgmt communicated that lower grade, longer logistics etc can lead to higher cost, and thus it's not entirely a surprise.Unit COGS for mined gold (weighted) saw higher increase to RMB272/q, +8.2% QoQ/+17.8% YoY. Besides what mentioned above, it also resulted from a combination of 1) higher gold royalty due to price surge and 2) relatively high cost in Akyem and La Arena during operation transition. Mgmt expect unit gold COGS to decrease sequentially in 2H25. For La Arena, the company has bought electric mining trucks to replace the few pre-existing trucks, to improve utilization at processing plants and thus reduce unit overhead; for Akyem, the company is re-evaluating operation model to extend open-pit operation period from 2027 currently to 2044,which will also significantly reduce unit overhead. On whole year basis, mgmt guides 5-8% unit cost increase in 2025 for both mined copper and gold.

**Kamoa recovery can take time, but other copper projects on track.** Kamoa 2025 guidance (100% basis) is reduced to 370-420kt due to seismic issue, and mgmt estimate c.40-90kt impact to Zijin's 2025 copper volume. Zijin's previous 2025 guidance of 1.15mt can be hard to achieve as a result, and we expect copper output to be largely flat YoY at 1.07mt instead, but we do not see significantly impact to the company's bottom line thanks to its diversified asset portfolio globally (earlier note here). Mgmt acknowledges it takes time to bring full Kamoa back on due to damage to the mining area. From Zijin's perspective, there is quite some room for improvement;e operation management, technical design etc, and they are working to find a way out. Other copper projects under Zijin's control are progressing as scheduled, incl Julong phases (Commission around 2025 year-end), caving method at Timok and Tongshan, etc.
(continued on the next page)
Please see analyst certifications, important disclosure information, and information regarding the status of non-US analysts on pages 4-9 of this report. * Jefferies Hong Kong Limited
Equity ResearchAugust 27,2025

**Shuhang Jiang * | Equity Analyst**
**Johnson Wan * | Equity Analyst**

Zijin has become one of the top gold & copper miners globally on aggressive and high- quality project acquisition and developments. The company is on track to deliver around \(10\%\) volume growth per year on average until 2028 for both copper and gold, which is rarely found among major global miners. In addition, Zijin is growing itself to become a major lithium producer, with 4 assets on hand. We are constructive on copper and gold prices in the long term, and Zijin is well positioned for the future super cycle. Buy.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View
Base Case, HK\\$29.6, +19%

Our Zijin- A PT is based on 16x FY25E P/E and EPS of RMB1.71. The target multiple reflects 5- year average historical PE. Commodity price assumptions under base case are USD3,210/oz for gold and USD4.3/lb for copper in FY25E. Our PT for Zijin- H is based on A share adjusted for FX and no premium or discount to H.
Upside Scenario, HK\\$36.2, +46%
Commodity price assumption under bull case is USD 3,400/oz for gold and USD4.5/lb for copper in FY25E. 2025E EPS is RMB1.85. Target multiple is 18x.
Downside Scenario, HK\\$16.4, - 34%
Commodity price assumption under bear case is USD 3,000/oz for gold and USD4.0/lb for copper in FY25E. 2025E EPS is RMB1.15. Target multiple is 10x.

Zijin Mining is the largest copper and gold miner in China with gold and copper reserve of 792t and 20.3mt in 2021, accounting for \(41.1\%\) and \(75.3\%\) of China total reserve respectively. As a mine company, its key issues include land restoration, workforce safety and solid waste management.
Aims to promote ecological restoration and protect biodiversity in mining area. Aims to reduce work- related fatality and protect workers' safety. Aims to reduce water emission.
What is the plan to protect the biodiversity in mining area, since mining work would change the original ecology? What kind of works has been done to protect employees' safety during work?
Faster ramp- up of expansion projects, lower production cost, higher- than- expected commodity prices

**No rush to achieve lithium guidance.** The company projected c.7kt lithium compound in 1H25,incl contribution from newly acquired Zangge Mining (Zangge's Production was c.5kt in 1H,and we estimate close to 2kt contribution to the mine since consolidation). The original guidance was 40kt earlier this year. However, the company strategically slowed down production/ project commissioning due to weak lithium market. Despite recent price recovery due to a few supply disruptions, the company has no plan to accelerate production in the near term, as they still prioritize technical upgrades to further reduce production costs. The updated cost targets are RMB35-40k/t for Lakkor Tso and Manono, RMB50-55k/t for Xiangyuan, and RMB60k/t for 3Q.

**Better interim payout.** Zijin announced 25% interim payout for 1H25, although it is lower than the 2024 full year payout of ~30%, it is higher than the 18% in 1H24 and interim payout has been lower in the past years. The company has a minimum payout of 30% for whole year, and mgmt is open to a higher payout if cash flow allows.

**Valuation.** We lowered our copper output est for 2025/26 to factor in impact from Kamoa, but revised up the bottom line as we are following a higher copper and gold price deck. Our target price for Zijin-A is based on 16x FY25E P/E and EPS of RMB1.71. The target multiple reflects the company's 5-year average historical PE. Commodity price assumptions under base case are USD3,210/oz for gold and USD4.3/lb for copper in FY25E. Our PT for Zijin-H is based on A share adjusted for FX and no premium or discount to H (vs 10% H share discount earlier, the discount is removed due to an overall H-share market rerating vs A share, which leads to a higher PT increase in the H shares). Maintain Buy on constructive copper+gold outlook and volume growth.
Figure 1 - Company snapshot - Zijin
Source: company info, Jefferies

Zijin MiningZijin Mining is China's largest miner of gold, copper, and other mineral resources. The company owns significant mining investment projects in 14 provinces (regions) domestically and 11 countries overseas, including a list of large production mines such as Fujian Zijinshan Gold and Copper Mine, Heilongjiang Duobaoshan Copper Mine, Porgera Gold Mine in Papua New Guinea, Kolwezi Copper and Cobalt Mine in the DR Congo, Bor Copper Mine in Serbia, Buritica Gold Mine in Colombia, and some world- class super large- scale high- grade mines in construction, such as Kamoa Copper Mine in DR Congo and Timok Copper and Gold Mine in Serbia.

Our Zijin- A PT is based on 16x FY25E P/E and EPS of RMB1.71. The target multiple reflects 5- year average historical PE. Commodity price assumptions under base case are USD3,210/oz for gold and USD4.3/lb for copper in FY25E. Our PT for Zijin- H is based on A share adjusted for FX and no premium or discount to H. Risks include lower- than- expected output ramp- up and lower- than- expected commodity prices.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR) Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company. NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies' methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
- Zijin Mining (601899 CH: CNY22.39, BUY)- Zijin Mining (2899 HK: HK\$24.80, BUY)
